FuncDef:
The telnet server-source command specifies a source interface for a Telnet server.
The undo telnet server-source command restores the default setting. The telnet server-source command specifies a source interface for a Telnet server. The undo telnet server-source command restores the default setting. By default, the source interface of a Telnet server is not specified.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the source interface type and interface number of a Telnet server.
-

Indicates that any interface having an IP address configured can be used as the source interface of a Telnet server.
-

Specifies the source interface name of a Telnet server.
-

ExtraInfo: To improve system security, you can run the telnet server-source command to specify a source interface address for the Telnet server. Then only authorized users can log in to the Telnet server.
